Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: thiago t
Reviews.Content: -bad shores experience: terrible toilet paper, hairdryer not working, low water pressure, smallest towels that i ever seen (at least there is 3, maybe i can make some origami to use them) -price is ok, but its possible to find a better cost benefit option. definitively not 4 stars (as booking.com classifies it) +have a good closet +is good located (very close to metro station, but there's some leak of light in the path)

Reviews.Title: “Segovia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location and price, poor on the room quality and some floors smell a little bit smoky. I tried the breakfasts and they are tasty and filling for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: volosong
Reviews.Content: Have had occasion to stay at Hotel Segovia four times in my travels. It is just across, (a very busy), street from Zona Rosa and close to the metro station. It is a good place to stay when flying into Mexico City and before heading out to other parts of the country. It is a very excellent value. The same room, across the street in Zona Rosa would cost three or four times as much. Next time I stay in Mexico City, I will be staying at Hotel Segovia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect option for "On a budget"”
Reviews.Author: Psicoloco
Reviews.Content: Flying 3 days and 2 nights for a wedding to Mexico City we ended making reservations in Segovia Regency by reading TripAdvisor's reviews and because Hotel is located near the location where the wedding took place (also got to give credit to the price). I'll have to say that the hotel is a perfect option for traveler's on a budget, what you see (pay) is what you get. The hotel is well located, just a 2 minute walk from Insurgentes Station where you can take the metro (subway) or the metro bus (trolley) and which connects you directly with blue and green line that will leave you in Zocalo in no time. It's 10 minute walk from Zona Rosa and Reforma Avenue, 20 minutes walk from Chapultepec. Basically everything is near. The hotel was always clean, rooms offered basic amenities and WiFi signal was always strong. Personnel was always attentive and kind, the restaurant of the hotel serves basic meals for very reasonable prices. For those foreigners concerned with Mexico's tap water quality, Hotel Segovia Regency offers free purify water in every room. Room service and 24 hours open front desk. Now, they're some things that you should consider before staying in my opinion: 1. the hotel needs to be remodeled, furniture (including beds) and rooms are quite old, it's not only a visual thing it's has to do with functionality and comfort. 2. the hotel doesn't have either an air conditioning system nor heating. 3. Room ventilation depends on windows. 4. Bathrooms are not the most attractive ones. 5. Rooms need to be soundproofed (heard noises almost every time while in the room). Overall a decent and basic place not luxurious or trendy at all. If money is not a problem or you're willing to pay 100 or 200 pesos more for a room try another hotel (we payed around 500 pesos for a night). We were on a hurry and couldn't find vacancy in our first option yet Segovia Regency is a the perfect spot for travelers on a budget. It offers a good value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Mexican Adventure”
Reviews.Author: recuerdeme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Segovia on a whim. It's close to Zona Rosa, well kept and very affordable. It's so close to Zona Rosa my bf and I walked there and back in the night with no problems... although the street separating the Hotel from Zona Rosa is pretty active most of the time. A couple of block down the road is the entrance to the subway which is very convenient. The room was nice and so was the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant, while not much to right about, was ok. In the end it's centrally located and probably the best price while keeping up with good standards of living.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good price, decent rooms, great service, and close to many interesting places and metro”
Reviews.Author: IceJose
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed there, we choosed this hotel because it was well rated and had one of the cheapest prices, we needed to visit the US Embassy, and itÂ´s really near the embassy and the CAS ( Centro de atencion a usuarios US Embassy) the room was clean, we asked to be changed for a street view room, the personnel at the hotel was very kind and they gave us all what we needed, the breakfast was excellent a very good price, and the thing I liked the most is that anything you can imagine is near the hotel, restaurants, theaters, OXXOÂ´s, Vips, etc. Other good thing is that there a LOT of security because in front of the hotel is the Police Parking Lot, so we were sorrounded day and night by patrols and policeman, (donÂ´t worry about sirens or something, they are just parked there) and also the Metro Insurgentes stations is really really close, you cant get to it trough a tunnel that leads you right to the station and a mini plaza thatÂ´s inside the metro.. and the Internet, is FREE I will sureeely come back.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s quite good place. Hotel is located near (3 min walk) from metro Station Insurgentes and main streets Pasada de Reforma and Zona Rose. Room was clean and comfortable. We left tips in the room, but they never took it. The windows faced to inner court, so it was quiet in the room. I liked decoration in lift halls: hotelâ€™s logotype on the sand. Quality for this price was very good. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, that is all”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in Mexico city, near Insurgente metro station. Honestly, I do not understand people in Mexico taking taxis, the city is always one big traffic jam, and metro, though crowded, serves pretty well. Insurgente square is surrounded by a number of cafes, bars, etc, many of them are gay. So if you want to find this sort of people, Zona Roza is your choice. Hotel is simple, breakfast not included, but prices for meal are not high. What I want to mention - they exchange euros for pesos (us dollars - no!), and exchange rate is very good, much better than in banks They have a small business centre on the 8th floor, ask, if you need PC, printer or want to store your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “sad service”
Reviews.Author: oso4284
Reviews.Content: I was there to do some personal business. I told my friends and family that I was stasying there and gave out the number along with my room number. My family called but they could not get through. The problem being the hotel phone opperator could not speak english. Instead of trying to help she just hung up the phone. My family called over 20 times but each time was hung on , no attempt to find out what they wanted. Sad, luckly it was not a life determining matter, but my family was worried as they could not reach me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Martin98
Reviews.Content: It was loud at night, and the staff did not care. The food was mediocre. I had a different price written on my check-in card when I checked out than when I checked in. I asked the clerk about the change. Iâ€™ve never seen a hotel clerk with anything like his reaction. I have never been in a situation like what then happened in my life. He was aggressive, insulting and he threatened me. He had the bell hop lock me in the lobby. It was early morning and I was alone. My wife arrived, and after some more yelling and tension, a second person arrived. He brought peace to the situation.

Reviews.Title: “nice but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it a nice place, very well located. the rooms are just the average room everywhere. but with no AC , no purified water, awfull shampoo ( really smells bad ) , you can hear all kind of noises, children running by the hall , children screaming , etc... i mean , its nice and clean , too clean actually that all the towels smells like bleach , actually all the bathroom smells like bleach , and i hate bleach. anyway , if you wanna be close to Zona rosa and all the gay lifestyle , go on , the good thing about this place is that is really cheap , and ... well located , ohhh i told you that already , aright , just try it .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, and was aware of the hotel from several visits to the City. First the room was too warm (Unusually warm for November) I asked twice for a fan for the room - no luck. I was told their was air-conditioning, but it only worked for about 4 hours over 4 days - and too noisy. No controls in the room. No menu for room service. No bottled water. No (Labeled) purified water faucets. Bathroom too small. I am a frequent traveler to Mexico city and have had much better at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “top bargain for zona rosa area”
Reviews.Author: leebids
Reviews.Content: Its a very good deal. Friendly staff, steps to subway. Ask for one of the rooms with a king size bed, which are much bigger than the other ones. It is very close to Zona Rosa and police station, but does not feel as safe at night as hotels actually in the Zona Rosa.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 month in this hotel and was Excellent. The Restaurant is delicious and have good prices, and very friendly and honest people work there. Next to Zona Rosa and near everywhere you want to go... I definetly recommend this hotel. The service is Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: pedmar
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at SEgovia twice in the last 6 mos. This is a great find!!! great price, service,and most of all, across the street from Zona Rosa(pink zone) entertainment/shopping area.The food is good, but I recommend let the staff know you are there as sometimes if busy they may be slow in service. The staff is very helpful.Enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Low rates by the Zona Rosa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Segovia Regency is a nice hotel just across the street (Avenue Chapultepec) from the Zona Rosa (Pink Zone). The hotels in the Zona Rosa Cost two or three times as much as the Hotel Segovia even though they are just across the street. It costs about 60.00$ U.S. per night go to their web site and get a 10% discount. I like the Hotel Segovia Regency because the employees make it a career of working here. They are professional, kind, courteous, and friendly. They are their to assist in your every need. In May 2002 there were numerous burglaries from the hotel room safes. I was one of them. The hotel manager and the front desk managers were very helpful in assisting me in contacting the police, moving rooms, and whatever else I needed. I filed the proper police reports and a claim with the hotel's insurance company. After approximately three months the insurance company reimbursed me the cash that was stolen from the safe. Any and all documentation, receipts, letters from witnesses, and photos you can copy and give them is very helpful. Because I use traveler's checks my vacation was not ruined, those were easily reimbursable. My credit cards on the other hand took some time. The credit card companines are not always able to do what they advertise, so beward of high expectations of these companies. You are probably wondering why I am reccomending the Hotel Segovia Regency. I have been staying with them since 1990 and I have stayed with them two times since this loss occurred. The people who work here make it a great hotel. I will continue to stay here. Bad things do happen to good people. So the best advice is to be prepared and have a plan in case something bad, no matter what it is does happen. Note, in Mexico if the crime is not in progress you go to the Police Station and file a report, then they come and investigate it. While it is time consuming this is how it is done. I would rate the rooms as well kept and clean. If you are travelling alone and like spacious spend about $10 more a night and get a double, it is worth the money. The food in the resturant is good. Although there are many fine resturants in Mexico City, an afternoon snack or a late dinner at the hotel resturant will hit the spot. A late night mocha or expresso is always good here, especially with a shot of Khalua. The hotel resturant is open till 11 p.m. The menu offers many choices with some being perpared very well, while some others I did not care for because it is not how I would prepare it. The room service is good, although sometimes the communication gap between my broken Spanish and their broken English does not always produce what I like. If you order cream with your coffee or tea it may be hot cream. Be sure to explain what you want and how you would like it. If it needs to be cold tell them, if you want it plain tell them. And if it is not perfect when it arrives they will fix it to meet your desires. While it is not the newest, nor the most modern the Hotel Segovia is a good place to stay. For those of you who like a nice hotel, central to everything, and with a wonderful staff the Hotel Segovia Regency is the place to stay. George Peter Hanzas!
